data: Text only recorded by transcription in manuscript tradition.
One of a set of forgeries produced in the immediate decades after the publication of Torremuzza 1769
Reportedly found in 1768 during work on the Chiesa di San Pietro, Trapani
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

The archaeological collection is housed in one long room that has been subdivided into 4 discrete areas containing 25 cases and a series of open displays. 1 case contains pre- and proto-historic material, 3 are for material from Selinunte, 1 Camarina, 8 Erice, 1 Mozia, 1 Birgi, 1 Lilybaeum, 1 Centuripe, 4 contain material of unknown origin, 1 mixed sites, and then 1 for Punic stamped amphora handles, 1 for Greek and Roman stamped amphora handles, and 1 for Latin epigraphy. In addition there are open displays of material found on the seabed (amphorae, anchor parts, a Roman ram from the Aegadi Islands battle), a large two-sided Latin inscription and a section on Arabic and later Jewish inscriptions
Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus

G. Kaibel, Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, Additis Graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae Inscriptionibus, Inscriptiones Graecae Consilio et Auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae Editae. Volumen XIV., XIV (Berlin: Georgius Reimerus, 1890)
A. Filippi, ‘Trapani: Testimonianze Storiche Ed Archeologiche’, Sicilia Archeologica 35, no. 100 (2002): 73–87
Un porto antico nel Mediterraneo. Archeologia e storia di Trapani dall'eta arcaica a quella bizantina
Antonio Filippi, Un Porto Antico Nel Mediterraneo. Archeologia e Storia Di Trapani Dall’eta Arcaica a Quella Bizantina (Erice: Il Sole editrice, 2005)
SEG LII 892-905 (Drepanon): Una serie di fasificazioni del XVIII secolo
K. Korhonen, ‘SEG LII 892-905 (Drepanon): Una Serie Di Fasificazioni Del XVIII Secolo’, Zeitschrift Für Papyrologie Und Epigraphik 201 (2017): 197–200
L L D Augusto sacrum et genio civitatis populus Drepanitorum

1L(- - -) L(- - -) D(- - -) Augusto sacrum et genio civitatis
2populus Drepanit(orum)

1LLDAUGUSTOSACRUMETGENIOCIVITATIS
2POPULUSDREPANIT

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text as reported by Kaibel from the manuscript tradition.

translation

commentary

As Korhonen 2017 lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV and provides the only modern corpus edition of this text. Korhonen 2017: 199 elucidates this, the only Latin text among them, as being derived from Jan Gruter's corpus (the 1707 posthumous second edition), specifically p.227 no.4 = CIL XIII.566 from Bordeaux, with the same 'Augusto sacrum et genio civitatis' construction.
